analysis.heading: Contextual garage placement
analysis.content: Contextual garage placement applies if, and only if, there is a predominant neighborhood pattern. How to determine if contextual garage placement applies (using Fig 32 below as an example). Note: If block is more than 600' long, consider only lots within 600' or the 10 lots closest to the subject lot. If subject lot is a corner lot, consider the pattern on the street that the subject garage faces.
figures: Fig 32: Example of a block diagram showing lot layouts with houses and garages, demonstrating contextual garage placement regulation. Lots are labeled A through H, with some marked as excluded (X'd out) and a subject house indicated.
codes: 1. Front-half pattern lots: lots with garage in front half of the lot (F)
2. Rear-half pattern lots: lots with garage in rear half of the lot (B & D) and lots with no garage (E) (counts as a rear-pattern lot)
